thread.section_title: Sports - The Daily Reporter - Coldwater, MI
thread.title: Coldwater remains undefeated with 40-14 win

author: Troy Tennyson Twitter: @ttennysonTDR
title: Coldwater remains undefeated with 40-14 win
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 9:13 AM Coldwater, Mich. BATTLE CREEK – The undefeated Coldwater Cardinals traveled to Battle Creek Harper Creek Friday night looking to lock up at least a share of the Interstate 8 conference crown with a win. Lock it up they did, as Coldwater grounded out a convincing win over the Beavers by the score of 40-14. Coldwater led off the scoring at the 9:49 mark of the first quarter as Sam DeMeester rumbled 60-yard for a touchdown. With the Sean Delaney PAT good, Coldwater quickly led 7-0. Spencer Burns next found pay dirt for the Cardinals as he put in the next three scores on the ground for Coldwater, running in from 26-yards, two-yards, and 7-yards to put Coldwater up 27-0. At 10:39 of the third quarter, Luke Beckhusen found Burns through the air this time, completing a 29-yard touchdown pass. The two-point conversion run by Beckhusen was good and the score stood at 33-0. Collin Torrey would put an end to the Coldwater scoring, as he ran the ball in from 10-yards out for the score. The PAT was good by Delaney giving Coldwater the 40-0 lead. Harper Creek would then add two mop up touchdowns on runs by AJ Mitchell and Zach Wilson to find the final score of 40-14. Coldwater outgained Harper Creek on the day offensively, 417 yards to 258. 358 of Coldwater’s yards came via the rush. Spencer Burns led the way for the Cardinals, rushing nine times for 118 yards and three touchdowns. Sam DeMeester added 10 carries for 86 yards and one score, while Collin Torrey added three carries for 76 yards and one score as well. Luke Beckhusen added five carries for 44 yards, while going 3 of 4 through the air for 59 yards and a score. Burns caught all three passes for 59 yards and one score. Defensively, the Cardinals were led on the day by Brandon Lewis and Collin Torrey who each had five tackles, while Jesse Miller and Austin Krzmenski added four tackles a piece. Krzmenski added an interception in the winning effort. Coldwater will look to continue their undefeated season next week when they travel to Charlotte. By Troy Tennyson   By Troy Tennyson
